Source file src/github.com/johnstarich/env2config/env_test.go

Documentation: github.com/johnstarich/env2config 

     1  package env2config
     2  
     3  import (
     4  	"testing"
     5  
     6  	"github.com/stretchr/testify/assert"
     7  )
     8  
     9  func TestParseEnv(t *testing.T) {
    10  	t.Parallel()
    11  	for _, tc := range []struct {
    12  		description string
    13  		envPairs    []string
    14  		expect      map[string]string
    15  		expectPanic string
    16  	}{
    17  		{
    18  			description: "no env",
    19  			expect:      map[string]string{},
    20  		},
    21  		{
    22  			description: "one pair",
    23  			envPairs: []string{
    24  				"A=B",
    25  			},
    26  			expect: map[string]string{
    27  				"A": "B",
    28  			},
    29  		},
    30  		{
    31  			description: "permits empty",
    32  			envPairs: []string{
    33  				"A=",
    34  			},
    35  			expect: map[string]string{
    36  				"A": "",
    37  			},
    38  		},
    39  		{
    40  			description: "permits non-alphanum",
    41  			envPairs: []string{
    42  				"A.B0=C",
    43  			},
    44  			expect: map[string]string{
    45  				"A.B0": "C",
    46  			},
    47  		},
    48  		{
    49  			description: "duplicate pairs keeps first",
    50  			envPairs: []string{
    51  				"A=B",
    52  				"A=D",
    53  			},
    54  			expect: map[string]string{
    55  				"A": "B",
    56  			},
    57  		},
    58  		{
    59  			description: "many pairs",
    60  			envPairs: []string{
    61  				"A=B",
    62  				"C=D",
    63  			},
    64  			expect: map[string]string{
    65  				"A": "B",
    66  				"C": "D",
    67  			},
    68  		},
    69  		{
    70  			description: "invalid env pair",
    71  			envPairs: []string{
    72  				"A",
    73  			},
    74  			expectPanic: "Invalid key value pair from os.Environ()",
    75  		},
    76  	} {
    77  		t.Run(tc.description, func(t *testing.T) {
    78  			if tc.expectPanic != "" {
    79  				assert.PanicsWithValue(t, tc.expectPanic, func() {
    80  					parseEnv(tc.envPairs)
    81  				})
    82  				return
    83  			}
    84  			assert.Equal(t, tc.expect, parseEnv(tc.envPairs))
    85  		})
    86  	}
    87  }
    88  
    89  func TestConfigValues(t *testing.T) {
    90  	t.Parallel()
    91  	for _, tc := range []struct {
    92  		description string
    93  		configName  string
    94  		env         map[string]string
    95  		expect      map[string]string
    96  	}{
    97  		{
    98  			description: "no env",
    99  			configName:  "prefix",
   100  			expect:      map[string]string{},
   101  		},
   102  		{
   103  			description: "prefixed config vars",
   104  			configName:  "prefix",
   105  			env: map[string]string{
   106  				"PREFIX_A":     "B",
   107  				"PREFIX_C_D_E": "F",
   108  			},
   109  			expect: map[string]string{
   110  				"A":     "B",
   111  				"C_D_E": "F",
   112  			},
   113  		},
   114  		{
   115  			description: "ignore other vars",
   116  			configName:  "prefix",
   117  			env: map[string]string{
   118  				"PREFIX_A": "B",
   119  				"OTHER_C":  "D",
   120  			},
   121  			expect: map[string]string{
   122  				"A": "B",
   123  			},
   124  		},
   125  		{
   126  			description: "ignore config opts",
   127  			configName:  "prefix",
   128  			env: map[string]string{
   129  				"PREFIX_A":      "B",
   130  				"PREFIX_OPTS_X": "D",
   131  			},
   132  			expect: map[string]string{
   133  				"A": "B",
   134  			},
   135  		},
   136  	} {
   137  		t.Run(tc.description, func(t *testing.T) {
   138  			assert.Equal(t, tc.expect, configEnvValues(tc.configName, tc.env))
   139  		})
   140  	}
   141  }
   142  

Build version go1.16.3.
